edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Class PhiFeatureExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.AbstractFeatureExtractor
      • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.PhiFeatureExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FeatureExtractor

    public class PhiFeatureExtractor
extends AbstractFeatureExtractor
    Extractor for p(e|f), one of the five base feature functions of Moses/Pharaoh.
    Author:
    Michel Galley

      • getRequiredPassNumber

        public int getRequiredPassNumber()
        Description copied from class: AbstractFeatureExtractor
        Returns the number of passes over the entire training data are required by the feature extractor. Unless this method is overridden, the default is 1.
        Overrides:
        getRequiredPassNumber in class AbstractFeatureExtractor
        Returns:
        number of required passes over training data

      • featurizePhrase

        public void featurizePhrase(AlignmentTemplateInstance alTemp,
                   AlignmentGrid alGrid)
        Description copied from class: AbstractFeatureExtractor
        Empty phrase-level feature extractor.
        Specified by:
        featurizePhrase in interface FeatureExtractor
        Overrides:
        featurizePhrase in class AbstractFeatureExtractor
        Parameters:
        alTemp - A particular occurrence of an alignment template.
        alGrid - A two dimensional array, in which each cell (i,j) contains the set of AlignmentTemplateInstance objects that have one of their four corners lying at (i,j) in the alignment grid. Not that if FeatureExtractor.needAlGrid() returns false, alTemps is always null.

      • score

        public Object score(AlignmentTemplate alTemp)
        Print the five translation model features that appear in Moses' phrase tables.
        Specified by:
        score in interface FeatureExtractor
        Overrides:
        score in class AbstractFeatureExtractor
        Parameters:
        alTemp - Alignment template to score.
        Returns:
        Feature values, which must either be represented as double[].
